data.title: Amazing casual eats and relaxed atmosphere
data.text: I've eaten at Brick and Porter 3 or 4 times in the past 2 months and we just keep coming back for more! The food is so tasty and I can tell it's all fresh with quality ingredients.  We dined here for lunch with co-workers and everyone has loved their food. I've tried the crispy chicken wrap with fries and their homemade aioli on the sand which is to die for. The fries are great too and we all found ourselves eating every last crumb. I recently had a Cobb salad which was a great portion and great price.  Other diners at my table have had a giant burger with a fried egg and bacon on top, a French dip and the soup of the day. It all looked great and we practically licked our plates. Lunch entrees are around $8-12. Atmosphere is very relaxed but slightly trendy at the same time.

data.title: Great
data.text: Great service and the food was wonderful had the tuna tostadas and a delicious burger.  Burger was cooked to order perfectly and very juicy. Will try again

data.title: Great Food and Atmostphere
data.text: We wanted to try someplace new and decided on Brick and Porter.  They now have a new "regular".  Our waitress was very attentive and knowledgeable.  Since it was a bit later seating was not a problem and our food was delivered promptly.  We decided to split a burger since they were huge and were happy that we did.  We also tried the fried pickles and they were fantastic.  The regular order is huge!  Beer selection was great with plenty of selections of porters and my wife appreciated the wine selection.

data.title: Friends night out
data.text: Arrived about 6:00 pm.  Restaurant was very busy.  We were going to order a drink at the bar, but then a table opened up.  This is a seat yourself restaurant, but that isn't usually a problem.  The food was great.  Two of us had fish and chips which were very good. My friend had a French Dip which she declared to be excellent.  Husband had a Reuben, but it was made with Pastrami, which is unusual.  French fries were very good as was the beer selection. Not a quiet place, but there are very few of them now days.  Overall, we would go back again.

data.title: service is great, atmosphere so-so
data.text: We wandered into this bar on a Friday night (about 10:00pm), and found two seats at the bar immediately.  Our bartender was great.  She greeted us right away, and was able to suggest eight different bourbons to us off the top of her head.  Impressive.  Even though the place was pretty busy, we always received prompt service.  Our drinks themselves were decent (perhaps a bit weak and/or smaller volume than other bars).  The atmosphere was the only reason I couldn't give this place a higher rating.  This bar isn't an elegant place, nor an intimate one.  It's just a typical loud bar.  There are better bars in the area atmosphere-wise, places that are cozier, and focus more on the patron's overall experience.  Brick and Porter is great for a stop-in drink or two.

data.title: No toilet paper in bathroom
data.text: Ok ... who's managing facility whereas there is no toilet paper in the woman's restroom...shame on them.  This should never happen anywhere when out at a restaurant!  Management not overseeing their responsibilities!  I'll be Boycotting for at least 30 days and sharing on social media…make a routine to leave loose rolls of toilet paper available in restroom…duh!

data.title: Best dirty Martini in Grand Rapids
data.text: Yes, as others have stated, they have a great wine and beer selection and other delicious specialty drinks BUT, they make the best dirty martini in Grand Rapids...perfectly done with an abundance of olives. Recommended dinners: fish and chips or the fish tacos. Both were excellent. Waitstaff were attentive, friendly and fun. They seem to actually help each other so you don't have to hunt for your waiter if you need something. It's an easy walk from any downtown hotel. So many great places to eat in downtown Grand Rapids. If you want great pub food in a fun setting, Brick and Porter will not disappoint!

data.title: A Place not to miss
data.text: Frist time there . They have a beer and wine list that is very nice, There were four of us and we all had something different, none of us were disappointed. The sandwiches were tasty and very filling. The service was above par. Would definetly go back again..

data.title: Best. Burgers. Ever.
data.text: Brick and Porter caught my eye because of how busy it was--that's always a good sign to a tourist. The service was incredible, the waitresses were extremely polite and attentive like. The prices were reasonable. And, finally, their burgers were amazing! I'm talking clean-your-whole-plate amazing! It was actually cooked the way I requested it to be, the portion was generous, and it was very flavorful. Great place to go for some good food in downtown grand rapids!

data.title: A delightful pub/ restaurant
data.text:
What a pleasant surprise this restaurant was to my husband and me visiting Grand Rapids. 
Located in the center of town, this lively, restaurant has an extensive beer and wine list and a wide variety of menu options. 
All dishes had a beautiful presentation and more importantly were delicious large portions at reasonable prices. 
The staff couldn't have been sweeter or more efficient. 
Our meals were delicious   I had the salmon which is served with fresh cooked vegetable; tonite's was asparagus.  They substituted with no hassle the mashed potatoes for a salad. 
The prices are reasonable, service warm and efficient and the restaurant conversation friendly.

data.title: Yum
data.text: So many good items on the menu!! Michigan walnut salad fabulous. Clean bathrooms.  Can accommodate larger families. Sports showing on tv.

data.title: Great service and atmosphere
data.text: Stopped by late at night to watch the game and enjoy drinks and appetizers.  Service was extremely friendly and attentive.  The atmosphere was great with a good crowd but not too crowded.  A great selection of beer and wine.  The food was very good.  We will be back for sure.

data.title: Great bar / great atmosphere
data.text: This place has a great atmosphere, along with one of the best draft beer choices around.  The food is good too!  Large portions at a reasonable price.

data.title: Perfect Pub
data.text: This joint is great. Really loved the decor with brick and dark wood. Staff was really nice and helpful. Prices were great and quick service. Our group really loved their salads and the big meat wagon burger. We'll certainly return.

data.title: Definitely not great
data.text: My family and I decided to try this place out for lunch.  All of us were very disappointed with the food. We only ordered appetizers as we were going to eat a large dinner later. It took 40 minutes for the appetizers to come out which was definitely too long.  The wings were overcooked and the pork nachos were cold.  All of the food didnt even come out at the same time.  The waitress however was very nice and did do a good job. The patio was also nice.

data.title: Great food and outstanding customer service.
data.text: We are in town for our annual mid-year meeting.  Our first night in town and we were on our own.  It was late and we came upon this place.  The staff was outstanding and the food was amazing.  Highly recommend this place.

data.title: Very positive experience
data.text: This was our first time here.  We all had dinner and drinks.  Everything was reasonably priced and very flavorful.  I had the shrimp tacos which were amazing.  The atmosphere is very laid back and comfortable.  Our server Ashley was very informative and fun.  She even posed for a selfie after she unsuccessfully tried to photobomb us.  She put up with our goofy behavior and didn't seem annoyed at all.  We will definitely be coming back again.

data.title: My kind of place
data.text: I have been here several times and they are doing great for a new place! Very friendly staff,service is fast and food delicious! If you are into pretentious places don't go here!!  Just great food and service in a Cheers type atmosphere!!

data.title: Great Food and Service by Sierra
data.text: The food and service were excellent.  The restaurant is very clean with reasonable prices and they take restaurant.com certificates.  Brisket was great.

data.title: Generous portions, delicious food, friendly staff
data.text:
Had the opportunity to enjoy this eatery twice during a recent visit. Food was excellent and much more than I could finish on the plate. Meals came out hot and nicely plated. Even our large group of 14 on the second visit was accommodated quickly and easily handled by our wonderful server Jennifer. 
Sandwiches, entrees, appetizers and a large selection of craft beers (which we did not sample) had something for everyone on the menu.
